description: We have all seen forensic scientists in TV shows

description: Gmail es el servicio de correo electrónico basado en la nube de Google que le permite acceder a sus mensajes desde cualquier computadora o dispositivo con solo un navegador web.

column8: ver diferentes formatos de archivos sin tener que usar software adicional y acceder a sus archivos desde cualquier dispositivo.

title: Gestion de projet Agile
description: Il s’agit du cinquième cours du programme de Certification en gestion de projet Google. Ce cours explorera l’historique
column7: l’approche et la philosophie de la gestion de projet Agile
column8: notamment le cadre Scrum. Vous apprendrez à différencier et à combiner Agile à d’autres approches de gestion de projet. Au fur et à mesure que vous progresserez dans le cours
column9: vous en apprendrez plus sur Scrum
column10: en explorant ses piliers et ses valeurs et en comparant les rôles essentiels de l’équipe Scrum. Vous découvrirez comment créer
column11: gérer et affiner un carnet de produit
column12: mettre en œuvre les stratégies de livraison axées sur la valeur d’Agile et définir une feuille de route de la valeur. Vous apprendrez aussi des stratégies pour organiser efficacement les cinq événements Scrum importants pour une équipe Scrum
column13: introduire une approche Agile ou Scrum dans une organisation et encadrer une équipe Agile. Enfin
column14: vous apprendrez à rechercher et à décrocher des missions dans un poste Agile. Les chefs de projet Google actuels continueront de vous former et de vous fournir les approches pratiques
column15: les outils et les ressources nécessaires pour atteindre vos objectifs.

title: Organizational Leadership
description: Some related experience required.

title: Discrete Optimization
description: Tired of solving Sudokus by hand? This class teaches you how to solve complex search problems with discrete optimization concepts and algorithms

title: Big Data – Introducción al uso práctico de datos masivos
Leadership Through Marketing
description: The success of every organization depends on attracting and retaining customers. Although the marketing concepts for doing so are well established
column8: while producing massive amounts of data
column9: revolutionizing the processes through which organizations attract and retain customers. In this course
column10: students will learn how to identify new opportunities to create value for empowered consumers
column11: develop strategies that yield an advantage over rivals
column12: and develop the data science skills to lead more effectively
column14: and to confront this very challenging environment with confidence.

title: Organizational Leadership Capstone
description: The capstone project consists of a case study that must be addressed to complete the specialization.

title: Big Data: capstone project
description: En este último curso de la Especialización Big Data el estudiante tendrá la oportunidad de aplicar algunas de las herramientas y métodos aprendidos en los cursos anteriores en un caso práctico.

title: Digital Product Management: Modern Fundamentals
description: Not so long ago
column7: the job of product manager was about assessing market data
column9: and managing the hand-off to sales/marketing. Maybe you’d talk to a customer somewhere in there and they’d tell you what features they wanted. But companies that manage product that way are dying.

title: Database Design and Basic SQL in PostgreSQL
description: In this course you will learn more about the historical design of databases and the use of SQL in the PostgreSQL environment. Using SQL techniques and common commands (INSERT INTO
column10: etc) will enable you to create tables
column11: column types and define the schema of your data in PostgreSQL.    You will learn about data modeling and how to represent one-to-many and many-to-many relationships in PostgreSQL.   Students will do hands-on assignments creating tables
column14: creating relational structures and inserting and querying relational data in tables.

title: Building Web Applications in Django
description: In this course
column7: you will learn how Django communicates with a database through model objects. You will explore Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) for database access and how Django models implement this pattern.  We will review the Object-Oriented (OO) pattern in Python.  You will learn basic Structured Query Language (SQL) and database modeling
column8: including one-to-many and many-to-many relationships and how they work in both the SQL and Django models. You will learn how to use the Django console and scripts to work with your application objects interactively.

title: Building Web Applications in PHP
description: In this course
column7: you'll explore the basic structure of a web application
column8: and how a web browser interacts with a web server. You'll be introduced to the request/response cycle
column9: including GET/POST/Redirect. You'll also gain an introductory understanding of Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
column10: as well as the basic syntax and data structures of the PHP language
column17: among other elements. An introduction to Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) will allow you to style markup for webpages. Lastly
column18: you'll gain the skills and knowledge to install and use an integrated PHP/MySQL environment like XAMPP or MAMP.

title: Research Report: Delivering Insights
description: You have completed all the hard work of conducting your internal
column8: and primary research. You have analyzed all the data and are able to formulate insights and recommendations based on your research proposal. But what is the best way to present your findings and be able to make a decision?

title: Teaching Writing Process
description: Half a century ago
column7: a revolution took place in the teaching of writing. Educators asked
column8: “What if we were to study how professional writers wrote
column9: as a way to learn how we might teach writing more effectively?” The result was the writing process movement
column10: with its emphasis on not just writing as product but as process. Good writing doesn’t magically appear
column11: nor does it spring from the brain fully formed and perfect the first time. Instead
column12: all writers engage in a process
column13: and while that process can vary writer to writer
column14: some stages do seem to apply
column16: to almost every writing situation. This course demonstrates how teaching writing as process can lead to a significant increase in students’ comfort level and confidence as writers. Learners will examine methods for teaching writing as discovery
column17: and for using low-stakes writing and reflection in their classes. They’ll fill their toolbox with practical strategies and techniques for teaching writing to students of any age

title: Writing and Editing: Drafting
description: This third course in the “Good with Words: Writing and Editing” series will give you a number of strategies to help with what is often the most intimidating
column7: even paralyzing part of the writing process: getting started.

title: Teaching Reluctant Writers
description: All educators will encounter students who struggle with writing. This course first focuses on the reasons student writers may be reluctant and then provides learners with a variety of strategies and practices to help reluctant writers develop a greater comfort and confidence with writing. Learners will examine classroom relationships
column11: all tools and techniques that can be brought right into the classroom to help struggling writers increase student participation and success in writing. They'll conduct their own study of one reluctant writer and use their learning to help create a plan for teaching reluctant writers in their current and future classrooms.

title: Privacy in the USA
description: After having followed Privacy in the Western world you have become acquainted with the overall global legal system and the origins of privacy as a concept as well as privacy as a (human) right. This course deals with the American legal system to protect privacy.

title: Practical Machine Learning
description: One of the most common tasks performed by data scientists and data analysts are prediction and machine learning. This course will cover the basic components of building and applying prediction functions with an emphasis on practical applications. The course will provide basic grounding in concepts such as training and tests sets
column8: and error rates. The course will also introduce a range of model based and algorithmic machine learning methods including regression
column11: and random forests. The course will cover the complete process of building prediction functions including data collection

title: Burgos: Deciphering Secrets of Medieval Spain
description: This advanced course focuses on two primary goals: (1) appraising how Jews
column8: and Muslims shaped the history of medieval Spain and (2) mastering the craft of Spanish paleography
column9: the skill of identifying Spanish handwriting in the 11th- through 15th-century manuscripts. Through the lens of the medieval history of Burgos
column10: we dedicate 75% percent of our efforts to developing pragmatic expertise in the interpretation of Carolingian/French/Gothic handwriting.
